interventions.mechanism: modulating immune response and reducing inflammation

No significant differences in serum total IgE
Adverse events were mild and transient

effects sustained for 12 weeks post-treatment
only mild, localized adverse events reported

comparison of hypergastrinemia development between tegoprazan and lansoprazole
findings: baseline gastrin levels were similar between groups (P = 0.335)
tegoprazan group had significantly lower gastrin levels at weeks 16 (P = 0.001) and 24 (P = 0.001) compared to lansoprazole
tegoprazan group had lower incidence of hypergastrinemia compared to lansoprazole

cognitive bias modification

PA improvements sustained at 4-week follow-up

interventions.mechanism: NMDA receptor antagonism leading to rapid antidepressant effects

study.adverse_effects: well-tolerated with no serious adverse events
study_focus: efficacy of oral ketamine in treating depression
comparison with midazolam as an active comparator
antidepressant efficacy in meta-analysis
measured_metrics: MADRS score reduction after one week
findings: response rates favored ketamine with NNT = 4.6 at one week (95% CI: [2.4, 62.6])
meta-analysis of 592 patients showed NNT = 4.89 for response and NNT = 9.16 for remission
treatment was well-tolerated with no serious adverse events reported

paper.title: Oral ketamine for the treatment of major depressive and bipolar disorder, a randomized controlled trial and meta-analysis.

interventions.mechanism: nutrient support for neurodevelopment

study.duration: cohort follow-up of children aged 7-9 years
study.population: school-aged children (7-9 years) in rural Nepal, offspring of participants in prenatal and preschool randomized trials
study.study_focus: impact of prenatal and preschool micronutrient supplementation on ADHD-related behaviors in school-aged children
findings: Prenatal iron-folic acid reduced oppositionality/hyperactivity and inattention scores (parent ratings)
Prenatal iron-folic acid with zinc reversed the positive effect of iron-folic acid alone
Prenatal multiple micronutrients reduced oppositionality/hyperactivity (parent and teacher ratings)
Preschool iron-folic acid, zinc, or iron-folic acid+zinc reduced parent-reported inattention
Preschool iron-folic acid or iron-folic acid+zinc reduced teacher-reported hyperactivity

paper.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

interventions.mechanism: Improves physical symptoms and brain fog, enhances awareness of activity limits, and promotes behavioral changes to manage post-exertional malaise

study.population: Adults with ME/CFS who did not improve after ≥3 months of conventional therapy (7 male, 41 female; age 20–70 years), including those with comorbid FM
study_focus: effect of recumbent isometric yoga on daily functioning
fatigue reduction in ME/CFS patients
findings: PS scores significantly lower in the yoga group (P < 0.001) compared to control, indicating improved functioning
Chalder FS scores decreased more in the yoga group (P < 0.01) than control
Subgroup analysis showed significant reduction in Chalder FS scores for severe ME/CFS and comorbid fibromyalgia (FM) patients (P < 0.001 and P < 0.01, respectively)
No serious adverse effects reported; patients noted improvements in physical symptoms, brain fog, and behavioral changes

paper.title: Effects of recumbent isometric yoga on the daily functioning level of patients with myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome: a randomized, controlled trial.

interventions.mechanism: direct mechanical clot removal

study_focus: comparison of reperfusion strategies
mortality outcomes in PE treatment
findings: CDI/SE showed 34-37% lower mortality vs ST (OR 0.34-0.37)
CDI reduced RV dysfunction (OR 0.28)
CDI trended toward fewer bleeding complications
ST had highest mortality (P-score 0.0008)

intervention.name: ureteral access sheath (UAS) use during RIRS

hierarchy.layer_2_variant: ureteral access sheath (UAS) use during RIRS

interventions.mechanism: facilitates stone removal by providing better access during surgery

study.population: patients undergoing RIRS for kidney stones
study.adverse_effects: increased perioperative morbidity (e.g., longer operative time, higher postoperative stenting)
study.study_focus: impact of ureteral access sheath (UAS) use on perioperative outcomes in ureteroscopy (RIRS)
findings: Stone-free rate (SFR) at three months was comparable between UAS and no UAS groups (OR = 0.75; 95% CI [0.53-1.08]; p = 0.12)
UAS use was associated with longer operative time (estimate = 3.71 min; 95% CI [1.08-7.32]; p = 0.04)
Lower probability of outpatient procedure with UAS (OR = 0.67; 95% CI [0.49-0.91]; p = 0.01)
Higher likelihood of postoperative stenting with UAS (OR = 3.61; 95% CI [2.72-4.78]; p < 0.001)
No significant differences in overall complications (OR = 1.16; 95% CI [0.68-1.99]; p = 0.57) or major complications (OR = 1.07; 95% CI [0.45-2.57]; p = 0.86)

paper.title: Does the use of a ureteral access sheath improve perioperative outcomes in ureteroscopy? A real-world multi-institutional study.

study.type: network meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials
study_focus: comparative efficacy of electroacupuncture vs conventional acupuncture
placebo control validity in acupuncture trials
findings: electroacupuncture reduced pain (SMD: -1.42; 95% CI: [-1.87, -0.98])
conventional acupuncture reduced pain (SMD: -1.11; 95% CI: [-1.49, -0.73])
electroacupuncture most effective (97.7% ranking) followed by conventional acupuncture (75.1%)
non-acupoint sham acupuncture showed 29.1% effectiveness

interventions.mechanism: reduced retear rates through improved anchor fixation
mechanism_canonical_names: improved anchor fixation for tendon repair

study.population: patients with rotator cuff tears of varying sizes
study_focus: cost-effectiveness of arthroscopic rotator cuff repair constructs
long-term outcomes of different surgical techniques
findings: for small/medium tears, DR knotted Corkscrew/Swivelock Biocomposite had ICER $12,562/QALY (0.54 QALY gain)
for large tears, DR knotless Swivelock Biocomposite had ICER $19,836/QALY (0.53 QALY gain)
for massive tears, DR knotless Healicoil PEEK/Footprint Ultra PEEK had ICER $27,748/QALY (0.46 QALY gain)
operative management showed increasing cost-effectiveness over 10 years compared to nonoperative care

intervention.name: conventional treatment combined with Bifidobacterium-Lactobacillus triplex live bacteria

interventions.mechanism: modulates gut microbiota and immune response

study_focus: efficacy of probiotics in asthma treatment
safety of probiotics in children with asthma
findings: conventional treatment combined with probiotics improved outcome indicators better than conventional treatment alone
Bifidobacterium-Lactobacillus triplex live bacteria showed highest probability for improving FEV1% and reducing recurrence rate
Bifidobacterium adolescentis showed highest probability for improving FEV1
Lactobacillus tablets showed highest probability for improving peak expiratory flow
Bacillus subtilis diplex live bacteria showed highest probability for improving total clinical response rate
Bifidobacterium quadruplex live bacteria showed highest probability for reducing IL-4 and IL-33
Bifidobacterium triplex live bacteria showed highest probability for improving C-ACT score
overall evidence quality was low or moderate

intervention.name: conventional treatment combined with Lactobacillus tablets

hierarchy.layer_2_variant: conventional treatment combined with Lactobacillus tablets

interventions.mechanism: modulates gut microbiota and immune response

study_focus: efficacy of probiotics in asthma treatment
safety of probiotics in children with asthma
findings: conventional treatment combined with probiotics improved outcome indicators better than conventional treatment alone
Bifidobacterium-Lactobacillus triplex live bacteria showed highest probability for improving FEV1% and reducing recurrence rate
Bifidobacterium adolescentis showed highest probability for improving FEV1
Lactobacillus tablets showed highest probability for improving peak expiratory flow
Bacillus subtilis diplex live bacteria showed highest probability for improving total clinical response rate
Bifidobacterium quadruplex live bacteria showed highest probability for reducing IL-4 and IL-33
Bifidobacterium triplex live bacteria showed highest probability for improving C-ACT score
overall evidence quality was low or moderate

paper.title: A network meta-analysis of

interventions.mechanism: improved insulin sensitivity and metabolic health

study_focus: effects of High-Intensity Functional Training (HIFT) and spinach-derived thylakoid supplementation on adipo-myokines, glycemic control, and lipid profiles in obese males
comparison of HIFT alone, thylakoid supplementation alone, and their combination on metabolic parameters
measured_metrics: lipid profile (HDL-C, LDL-C, triglycerides [TG], total cholesterol [TC])
body composition (BMI, fat mass [FM], fat-free mass [FFM])
findings: significant group × time interactions for all variables (p < 0.001) with reductions in adipokine levels (CTRP-9, CTRP-2, GDF-8, GDF-15), BMI, fat mass, LDL-C, TC, TG, insulin, glucose, and HOMA-IR, and increases in HDL-C (p < 0.05)
HIFT+Thyl showed greater improvements in adipo-myokines, lipid profile, glycemic control, and body fat compared to Thyl alone (p < 0.05)
HIFT and HIFT+Thyl had comparable reductions in BMI, fat mass, and improvements in lipid profile and insulin sensitivity

paper.title: Impact of using supplemented thylakoids derived from spinach for 12 weeks of high-intensity functional training on adipo-myokines in obese males.

condition.name: positional pain during spinal anesthesia in hip fracture patients

hierarchy.layer_2_variant: positional pain during spinal anesthesia in hip fracture patients

interventions.mechanism: targeted nerve block reduces pain signals during positioning
mechanism_canonical_names: targeted nerve block for pain signal reduction

study.population: ASA II-III patients aged 35–90 years scheduled for hip fracture surgery under spinal anesthesia; excluded patients with contraindications for spinal anesthesia or PENG block, cognitive dysfunction, or previous analgesic use within 12 hours
study_focus: efficacy of ultrasound-guided pericapsular nerve group (PENG) block versus intravenous ketamine in managing positional pain before spinal anesthesia
measured_metrics: Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) for pain intensity
Quality of Recovery-15 (QoR-15) for patient satisfaction
findings: PENG block significantly reduced pre-positioning NRS scores (2 vs 4, P<0.001)
PENG block reduced positioning NRS scores (2 vs 5, P<0.001)
PENG block reduced post-positioning NRS scores (2 vs 3, P<0.001) compared to ketamine
PENG group had lower total tramadol consumption (50 mg vs 100 mg, P<0.001)
PENG group had delayed time to first analgesia request (10.5 vs 5.6 hours, P<0.001)
PENG group reported fewer adverse effects (e.g., nausea: 0% vs 12.5%, P=0.045)

paper.title: Comparison of Ultrasound-Guided Pericapsular Nerve Group Block Versus Intravenous Ketamine for Positional Pain Management Before Spinal Anesthesia in Patients Who Underwent Hip Fracture Surgery: A Randomized Controlled Trial.

interventions.mechanism: inhibits interleukin-12 and interleukin-23 pathways

study.population: patients with moderate-to-severe chronic plaque psoriasis
study.adverse_effects: 37.8% of patients had at least one treatment-emergent adverse event
study.study_focus: comparative efficacy and safety of biosimilar Bmab 1200 versus reference ustekinumab
measured_metrics: Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) scores
findings: At Week 52, mean PASI reduction was -95.5% (Bmab 1200), -96.6% (continued-reference ustekinumab), and -94.7% (switched-to-Bmab 1200)
Efficacy and safety outcomes were comparable across groups
37.8% of patients had at least one treatment-emergent adverse event
Post-switch antidrug antibody incidence was comparable (Bmab 1200: 63.7%; continued-reference ustekinumab: 80.2%; switched-to-Bmab 1200: 72.6%)

paper.title: Comparative efficacy and safety of biosimilar Bmab 1200 versus reference ustekinumab in moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis: 52-week findings from the Phase 3 STELLAR-2 trial.

impact of cognitive ability on treatment response
measured_metrics: Korean Adult ADHD Rating Scale (K-AARS) scores
findings: significant improvement in ASRS and K-AARS domains post-intervention
functional impairment improved significantly

higher attendance correlated with greater symptom reduction
comorbid depression did not affect outcomes

study_focus: efficacy of DMTs in preventing clinical demyelinating events

findings: DMTs reduced clinical demyelinating event risk (adjusted HR=0.37, 95% CI 0.15-0.95)
higher adverse event rates in DMT groups (RR=1.44, 95% CI 1.09-1.90)
21% of 1401 RIS patients received DMTs
no long-term benefits/adverse effects data beyond 5 years

interventions.mechanism: modulation of neural pathways to reduce seizure activity

study_focus: efficacy of trigeminal nerve stimulation (TNS) in seizure control
safety profile of TNS in DRE patients
findings: significant short-term response rate increase at 3 months (RR 2.03, 95% CI [1.07, 3.84], P=0.03)
borderline seizure frequency reduction at 3 months (RR 2.85, 95% CI [0.99, 8.22], P=0.05)
42% response rate at 3 months (95% CI 30-54%)
mean 29% seizure reduction at 3 months (95% CI 8-51%)
no significant long-term effects at 6/12 months (wide confidence intervals)

paper.title: Assessing the efficacy of trigeminal nerve stimulation for drug-resistant epilepsy: A systematic review and meta-analysis.

safety profile analysis
findings: no significant differences in global state, relapse, or metabolic effects between clozapine and quetiapine
clozapine associated with higher rates of somnolence, hypersalivation, and constipation
no significant differences in other adverse effects or early discontinuation rates

study.population: 54 patients (32 males, 22 females, mean age 51) with sub-renal RLNM from CRC
study_focus: comparison of multimodal treatment strategies
oncologic outcomes of RCT-surgery vs surgery-alone
findings: preoperative RCT associated with higher complete response rate (18.2% vs 0%, p=0.018)
median OS not reached in RCT-surgery group vs 73.9 months in surgery-alone group (p=0.909)
median RFS 13.1 months (RCT-surgery) vs 8.6 months (surgery-alone, p=0.153)
similar morbidity, mortality, and hospital stay between groups

interventions.mechanism: precise margin evaluation with 100% histological confirmation of tumor clearance

study.population: patients with basal cell carcinoma (BCC), cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC), and other non-melanoma skin cancers
study_focus: efficacy and mechanisms of surgical therapies
mechanisms of action of topical and systemic treatments
role of immunotherapy in advanced SCC
findings: Mohs Micrographic Surgery (MMS) achieves 100% margin evaluation with cure rates of 70-99% when wide margins are obtained
Imiquimod activates TLR7/8, inducing pro-inflammatory cytokines (IFN-α, TNF-α, IL-12) and anti-tumor immune responses
Radiation therapy (RTh) induces DNA damage and ROS production, leading to tumor cell death
Cemiplimab (PD-1 inhibitor) reduced tumor size in 50% of locally advanced/metastatic SCC patients and lowered recurrence risks in adjuvant therapy

paper.title: Indications and Mechanisms of Action of the Main Treatment Modalities for Non-Melanoma Skin Cancer.

improved pigmentation (1.81 vs 2.43, p=0.031)
enhanced pliability (1.43 vs 1.87, p=0.021)
lower total POSAS observer score (9.12 vs 12.18, p=0.003)

interventions.mechanism: enhances self-awareness alignment with personal values

study.population: patients with depressive (n=52) and anxiety disorders (n=52)
study_focus: mediating role of authenticity in psychotherapy
effectiveness of UP on authenticity
findings: UP group showed 0.97 higher authenticity (d=0.97, 95% CI [0.28, 1.65]) vs controls at post-treatment

effect sustained at 6-month follow-up
